bioghist.p: Father Christopher McEvoy (1840-1914) was born in Ireland. Before coming to Villanova College in 1866, he attended Notre Dame University and Niagara College. In 1868 he entered the novitiate at Villanova, Pennsylvania, and was ordained to the priesthood in 1871. After ordination, Father McEvoy was stationed at Our Mother of Consolation in Chestnut Hill, Pennsylvania, and in 1881 he opened the first parochial school there. From 1882 to 1890, he served as Provincial of the Province of Saint Thomas of Villanova. Father McEvoy next served at Villanova, where he was president of the College (1890-1894), Prior of the Augustinian Community, and Pastor of Saint Thomas of Villanova Church. He also served at Saint Denis’ in Ardmore, Pennsylvania; at Saint Augustine’s in Philadelphia; and, again, at Our Mother of Consolation in Chestnut Hill, Pennsylvania. Father McEvoy died at Villanova in 1914.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of an 1896 commemorative booklet of the 25th anniversary of Father Christopher Augustine McEvoy's ordination. The booklet includes a sermon by Father Laurence Augustine Delurey.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
